snippet: Wendy Sherman, the highest-ranking American official to set foot in the country in more than 20 years, met in Mogadishu with the new president and said that she saw signs of hope.
abstract: Wendy Sherman, under secretary of state for political affairs, visits Somalia and meets with new Pres Hassan Sheikh Mohamud, becoming highest-ranking American official to set foot in country in more than 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Wendy Sherman, the highest-ranking American official to set foot in the country in more than 20 years, met in Mogadishu with the new president and said that she saw signs of hope.

headline.seo: State Dept. Official Visits Mogadishu Amid Signs of Recovery
headline.main: State Dept. Official Visits Somalia Amid Signs of Recovery
headline.print_headline: State Dept. Official Visits Somalia Amid Signs of Recovery
